guaranteed to go well respiratory therapist at children hospital that specializes in congenital heart defects heart transplants and other ct surgeries there is no way that your friend 90 quote is gross gross exaggeration it would be much more accurate to say that good portion of heart defects that were *undiagnosed prior to birth* are result of parents choosing to forgo traditional prenatal care homebirths themselves do not *cause* heart disease or defects those babies were going to be sick no matter where or how they were born the difference is that babies who parents choose traditional prenatal care often have their defects diagnosed at the 20 week anatomy scan they ve had fetal echocardiograms and conferred with pediatric cardiac surgeons before birth the medical staff is ready for that sick baby the moment it born and provides the necessary care undiagnosed babies who are born at home do not have those advantages it may be hours or even days before it is recognized that the baby is sick and in the meantime incorrect pressures or flows in the baby cardiopulmonary system may be making their already precarious situation worse tl dr it not the homebirth that the problem it the lack of advanced prenatal care the 90 figure which is anecdotal and likely inaccurate only applies to cases undiagnosed before birth and not all congenital heart diseases and defects in general
